data.author: Ethan Hurwitz, Sports Editor
data.title: Bobcats fall to 0-1 in MAAC play, loses heartbreaker to Niagara
data.description: HAMDEN, Conn – The Quinnipiac men’s basketball team, who had been trending upwards among mid-major programs, took its early success into today’s MAAC opener. However, the Bobcats were unable to keep up their out-of-conference winning ways, falling to the Niagara Purple Eagles 64-60 Sunday afternoon. Dictating the final score was Niagara’s superstar tandem of sophomore...The post Bobcats fall to 0-1 in MAAC play, loses heartbreaker to Niagara appeared first on The Quinnipiac Chronicle.

data.author: By Northern Star Sports Staff
data.title: ‘All-Star: A Huskie Sports Podcast,’ Episode 6: End of the semester, hockey’s first win and more
data.description: In the final episode of All-Star for the fall 2022 semester, Sports Editor Skyler Kisellus sits down with Multimedia Editor Sean Reed and Sports Reporter Alex Crowe to discuss NIU women’s basketball’s seven-game win streak and NIU hockey’s first win of the season with first year head hockey coach Brad Stoffers.Listen to the full episode below, or on Spotify:Keep an eye out next semester for new episodes every week with new coverage of NIU sports, news, interviews and more.

data.author: Stephen Noh
data.title: Top NBA Draft prospects are only part of what makes Overtime Elite the most intriguing basketball league in the country
data.description: OTE is authentic. It's weird, it's loud and the level of play can be up and down. But it's definitely not boring, and it could turn into something pretty cool down the line.

data.author: Luis Lopez
data.title: Cibola girls basketball takes down Gila Ridge with big game at home
data.description: Cibola Raiders girls basketball defeated Gila Ridge at home 67-10 on Monday night to get to a record of 6-2 on the year. The Lady Raiders would quickly grab a hold of the lead, as an early bucket from Kiara Hinton gave Cibola a 2-0 lead. data.author: The Associated Press
data.title: New Mexico State suspends basketball player after shooting
data.description: LAS CRUCES, N.M. (AP) — New Mexico State’s athletic director says power forward Mike Peake has been suspended indefinitely from the basketball team in connection with last month’s fatal shooting of a student from a rival university. That game was canceled along with the Dec. 3 rematch in Las Cruces. Mario Moccia also told reporters […]

data.author: Derek Ruttan
data.title: Clarke Road vs Beal: high school boys basketball
data.description: The Beal Raiders took on the Clarke Road Trojans in TVRA senior boys basketball Tuesday at Beal. The Raiders won 52-33 for their second win of the season. The Trojans fell to 1-1. Photos by Derek Ruttan

data.description: Eastern Washington hopes to join the list of unheralded men’s basketball teams that have escaped Berkeley, Calif. with non-conference wins this season when the Eagles visit California on Wednesday night. data.author: Tribune News Service
data.title: Column: Grayal Gilkey, first to be inducted in both West and East Aurora Hall of Fame, is still the talk of the town. ‘He knows everybody.’
data.description: The late Chicago Bulls great often kiddingly referred to Grayal Gilkey as“ the mayor of Aurora.”. “Gilk,” as he’ s known on both sides of town, worked basketball camps at Aurora University, then known as Aurora College, from 1972 to 1986. There, he rubbed elbows with NBA-connected staffers like Sloan, Dick Motta, Ed Badger, Doug Collins and John Paxson.

data.author: Joe Lucia
data.title: NCAA considering unbundling women’s basketball tournament media rights from other events
data.description: The NCAA women’s basketball tournament has been a lightning rod for controversy in recent years, but a positive change may be in the works. Per the Sports Business Journal, the NCAA is considering unbundling the women’s tournament, and perhaps other events, from a larger package that includes various other championships, like baseball, softball, gymnastics, and Read more...The post NCAA considering unbundling women’s basketball tournament media rights from other events appeared first on Awful Announcing.

data.author: Airman 1st Class Mikaela Smith
data.title: 2022 JBLE Basketball Championship Game [Image 3 of 8]
data.description: U.S. Air Force Tech. Sgt. Michael Cherry, 10th Intelligence Squadron job title, prepares to go up for a lay-up while an Airman from the 497th Operations Support Squadron plays defense during the Joint Base Langley-Eustis Basketball Championship game at JBLE, Virginia, Feb. 23, 2022. Cherry was declared the most valuable player as a special award for the night. (U.S. Air Force photo by Airman Mikaela Smith)

data.author: Airman 1st Class Mikaela Smith
data.title: 2022 JBLE Basketball Championship Game [Image 2 of 8]
data.description: U.S. Air Force Airman assigned to the 497th Operations Support Squadron prepares to shoot the basketball during the Joint Base Langley-Eustis Basketball Championship game at JBLE, Virginia, Feb. 23, 2022. James Naismith invented the game of basketball in 1891 and it quickly became a world renowned sport. (U.S. Air Force photo by Airman Mikaela Smith)

data.author: Rick Nyman
data.title: Coahulla Creek Girls Stay Unbeaten With Victory Over Ringgold
data.description: Ringgold, GA-(WDEF-TV) The Coahulla Creek girls basketball team improved to 6-0 on the year after beating Ringgold on the road Friday by a final of 47-28. Categories: Sports – Local Sports News
